prompt: <description>Part 1: Cylindrical Object with Tapered Top and Flat Bottom Begin by creating a new coordinate system with no rotation (euler angles = [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]) and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. This will be the base for our first part. Create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. Within this sketch, draw a circle (circle_1) centered at [0.0792, 0.0792] with a radius of 0.0792. This will form a complete loop (loop_1) on face 1. Extrude the sketch by the depth of 0.1667 towards the normal and 0.0 in the opposite direction of the normal (extrude_depth_towards_normal = 0.1667, extrude_depth_opposite_normal = 0.0). Multiply the sketch by the scaling factor of 0.1583 (sketch_scale = 0.1583). Apply the "NewBodyFeatureOperation" to create a new solid body with this part. This part represents a cylindrical object with a tapered top and a flat bottom, having a width, length, and height of 0.1583, 0.1583, and 0.1667 respectively. Part 2: Cylindrical Object with Tapered End Create a new coordinate system with no rotation (euler angles = [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]) and a translation vector of [0.0333, 0.0333, 0.1667] based on part 1. Create a new sketch on face 1 of the new coordinate system. Draw a circle (circle_1) centered at [0.0458, 0.0458] with a radius of 0.0458 within the sketch. This will constitute a complete loop (loop_1) on face 1. Extrude the sketch by the depth of 0.5833 towards the normal and 0.0 in the opposite direction (extrude_depth_towards_normal = 0.5833, extrude_depth_opposite_normal = 0.0). Apply the scaling factor of 0.0917 to the sketch prior to extrusion (sketch_scale = 0.0917). Apply the "JoinFeatureOperation" to this part to merge its geometry with the previous part, creating a single solid body. This part is a cylindrical object with a tapered end, resembling a metallic tube or pipe. Its width, length, and height are 0.0917, 0.0917, and 0.5833 respectively. When combined, these two parts form a cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom, likely representing a flashlight or pen with a reflective surface, given the "final shape" description provided.</description>
